pullrequest.title: [Proposal] Remove URI scheme when matching SDF_PATH

content.raw:
This documentation is great, thanks for pointing me to it. The use case is to support user-defined paths at runtime. The `SDF_PATH` URI is a bit limited now because it only works with relative paths, and not for URIs like `model://`. I was hoping to more easily support `scheme:// -> path from env var`.

That said, for `ign-gazebo` maybe we can leave SDFormat untouched and use an `ign-common` callback for this instead.

On the documentation, this would mean changing item 4 to:

_4. If the environment variable SDF_PATH is set, libsdformat forms a new path by appending the URI to the contents of SDF_PATH and checks if the path exists. **If the URI has a scheme, the scheme is stripped first**._

I just had a quick chat with @{557058:095b1e12-74ed-4e20-b44f-2f0745b616e0} and he's looking into this, so I won't touch this PR for now.
